devdoc.author: Phil Chapin
devdoc.details: This is a proof-of-concept with security flaws; do not use on mainnet.

__callback(bytes32,string).details: No state can be passed so we get it from pendingQueries.

params._result: The name of the winning team

bet(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).details: If you want to debug, remove the requirement beforeGameTime(...)

params.gameTime: The UNIX timestamp for the game's date and start time
params.losingTeam: The name of the team the bettor wants to lose
params.winningTeam: The name of the team the bettor wants to win

triggerPayments(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).details: This function exits and we wait for the __callback(...) to fire.  No state can be passed so we save it in pendingQueries.

params.gameTime: The UNIX timestamp for the game's date and start time
params.teamName1: The name of one of the teams
params.teamName2: The name of the other team
